intro: Polygonella parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved mountain sandwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are usually pink or white in color. Polygonella parvifolia thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
